title: Turban Puneri Pagdi

  object_colour: multicolored

  physical_appearance: This is a Pune-style turban. It is red in colour
 with a woven top. The front of the turban features a multicoloured brocade section. On the right of the brocade
 there is a hanging tassel.

  subject_terms_1: folk costume tassel

  subject_terms_2: Tassels Ethnic costume Turbans Brocade

  subject_terms_3: Indian costumes

  subject_terms_4: 

  sgcool_label_text: This Puneri pagdi (Pune-style turban) is closely associated with the Pune region of Maharashtra
 where it was traditionally worn by courtiers or people with high social standing. This type of pagadi was also worn by the Peshwas in Maharashtra
 in a wider form. This style became common from the 19th century and is now the intellectual property of Pune  (from 2009)

metadata.physical_appearance: This is a Pune-style turban. It is red in colour, with a woven top. The front of the turban features a multicoloured brocade section. On the right of the brocade, there is a hanging tassel.
metadata.sgcool_label_text: This Puneri pagdi (Pune-style turban) is closely associated with the Pune region of Maharashtra, where it was traditionally worn by courtiers or people with high social standing. This type of pagadi was also worn by the Peshwas in Maharashtra, in a wider form. This style became common from the 19th century and is now the intellectual property of Pune  (from 2009)
